content:
Despite the late hour, the platform was abuzz with excitement. Tonight, a round of Mafia would be played below the streets of downtown Los Angeles; its thirteen players, here by prearrangement, were gathered at the far end of the platform, where they would be boarding the final train out of Union Station. The game's objective was simple: Whichever of the town or the mafia still remaining on board by the time they arrived in North Hollywood would be victorious. With the weather forecast promising a particularly chilly night, the stakes were high, but that stopped no one from drawing their roles for the evening as the train pulled into the station.

Rules

All rules listed in the Boilerplate Game Rules (rev. May 14, 2013) page apply to this game except where contradicted in the additional rules below:

  1. Do not use #BF0000. All other formatting is fair game.
  2. Days will have a deadline of two weeks, and Nights will last 48 hours. Deadline extensions will be granted only in extreme circumstances.
  3. Prods will be issued to players if they have not posted within a 48-hour period. Players who have been prodded have 48 hours to respond in the game thread before a replacement is sought. Saturday and Sunday will be considered a 24-hour period for purposes of activity.
  4. Lynches occur through simple majority (50% of living players + 1, rounded down). If no majority is reached at deadline or there is a majority of votes for No Lynch, the Day will end without a lynch. Once majority is reached, no further votes or unvotes will count.
  5. All players, including the lynched player, are allowed to talk in twilight phase until the thread is locked, at which point Day ends. Dead players may not post until the game has been officially declared over; no "Bah!" posts.
  6. Actions not received by deadline will be considered forfeit. Actions may be submitted ahead of time and can be changed as many times as desired; at deadline, the last action that was submitted will be used. Actions may be submitted by any means where I can be contacted.
  7. All actions will be processed according to Natural Action Resolution.
  8. Flavor is for entertainment purposes only and has no significance in the game.
  9. Any situations not covered above will be handled on an individual basis. I reserve the right to add, modify, or remove rules as necessary.

Sample Role PM

Welcome to Mini 1575, XXX!

You are a town vanilla.

You have no special abilities beyond the right to vote.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one member of the town remains standing.

The game thread is here. Please confirm by responding to this PM with your alignment and role.

I am so sorry for the delay in starting. There was a personal emergency I had to attend to, so things should be smoother now. Anyway, all confirmations are in.

Day 1 begins now.

Disclaimer: This post-game commentary reflects my views as a user and not as a List Moderator, and the views do not necessarily represent the policy of site administration.

...so, yes, this game had an interesting turn when it shouldn't have. I think the scum players did pretty well; they managed to escape suspicion long enough to last to LyLo, and they were a bunch who were complaining in the beginning about how bad they usually were as scum. You guys lurked just the right amount, too. Town also did pretty well, sort of. Some of you had some questionable decisions, and you really shouldn't have lynched mykonian without a claim, not only because he was actually something interesting. Replacements could have killed this game, but (most of) you guys were absolutely wonderful.

Anyway, I designed the game around the bulletproof and masons this time around to focus on self-defense, except you guys killed everyone that mattered and the commuter role landed on a lurker. This is probably why design guides suggest not to design around a single role/interaction.

The replacement of zabriel at the beginning of Day 3 was actually a mistake, as Night 2 should have continued until the slot was replaced and then some. Props to Quilford for catching that.

A couple of other things:

1) Revealing the result before the game is officially declared over. There's no policy against this, but, IMO, it's really discourteous to the moderator to do this. I haven't done flavor at all for this game, so I don't have much of an excuse this time around to be pissed off; however, this sort of thing really ruins it for me, and it might ruin it for other people who like to read flavor, as well. So, please don't do it? This has happened two games in a row now, and I am seriously reconsidering moderating another game.

2) Replacements. Sometimes things happen, so if you gotta go, you gotta go. Just have the courtesy to let the moderator know so nobody waits around for 4 days because you couldn't give your fellow players the courtesy of ten bloody seconds of your time with a quick and dirty "Replace me" PM. Purposefully flaking out makes you a goddamn coward.

Most of you were really good about this, so a heartfelt thank you goes out to you all. Please continue to be sweethearts.

Lastly, if you are slacking and I ask you if everything is okay, I am legitimately worried about you. If you don't respond, I'm going to assume that you are being a jerk when you are posting insubstantial one-liners every two days. If you log into the site, pick up your PMs, and don't have the balls to reply with a simple "Replace me," a heartfelt fuck you goes out to you. Really, why did you bother replacing in?

tl;dr - Most of you are wonderful. Fuck the rest of you.

My next game will most likely be a Mini Theme based on the video game Papers, Please. It's an awesome video game; go play it.
